e4: Adopting the new policy aligns with ethical business practices and adheres to transparent financial reporting, which can enhance investor trust and reduce legal liability. Although it may initially lead to market misinterpretations, effective communication strategies can mitigate such risks. Over time, honesty and clarity can build a stronger reputation and prevent sophisticated investors from exploiting information asymmetries, ultimately benefiting all stakeholders.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and honesty, ensuring that all financial data presented is unbiased and reflects true company performance. It should protect all investors from deception, equally empowering them with clear information to make informed decisions. Consideration should be given to effectively communicating any changes in policy to prevent misunderstandings, and maintaining compliance with legal and regulatory standards is crucial. Lastly, the policy should consider the impact on different investor groups, ensuring fairness and preventing any group from gaining undue advantage.
e6: What strategies will be deployed to communicate the change in reporting policy effectively to all investors? How will the transition be managed to ensure investor trust and minimize market shock? Are there legal and financial contingency plans in place to handle potential initial downturns in stock prices or SEC inquiries?
